snippet: House Republican leaders on Wednesday implored President Obama to sit down with them and begin negotiating in earnest to head off a fiscal crisis, but with flattery and displaying aggravation, they made it clear they are now playing on his turf.
abstract: House Republican leaders on Wednesday implored President Obama to sit down with them and begin negotiating in earnest to head off a fiscal crisis, but with flattery and displaying aggravation, they made it clear they are now playing on his turf.
lead_paragraph: House Republican leaders on Wednesday implored President Obama to sit down with them and begin negotiating in earnest to head off a fiscal crisis, but with flattery and displaying aggravation, they made it clear they are now playing on his turf. Read more »

headline.main: House Republicans Call for Negotiations to Begin
